div.p: Greetings. I have finally obtained from Bäler the receipt long desired by you. He expresses his greatest thanks for your services. As for what else I might write, I have nothing at the moment, both because I have written more frequently and extensively in recent days, and because I do not have much leisure time left. Therefore, I commend you to the grace of the Lord, along with your wife and children. I congratulate Zwingli on his calling and condition. May the Lord inspire in him a paternal spirit, so that he may be as much an ornament and benefit to this church as his father was! My wife and Musculus send their greetings to you.
Bern, June 7, 1549. Johannes Haller, yours sincerely.
You can recommend Gervasius to the people of Aargau, among whom the election of ministers rests. I will do the same.
To the most learned and renowned man, Heinrich Bullinger, the most faithful leader of the Zürich church, his lord and venerable compatriot. Zürich.
